name: Getting updates
description:
There are two mutually exclusive ways of receiving updates for your bot — the getUpdates method on one hand and Webhooks on the other. Incoming updates are stored on the server until the bot receives them either way, but they will not be kept longer than 24 hours.

Regardless of which option you choose, you will receive JSON-serialized Update objects as a result.

docTypes.name: Update
docTypes.description:
This object represents an incoming update.
At most one of the optional parameters can be present in any given update.

docFields.name: update_id
docFields.description: The update's unique identifier. Update identifiers start from a certain positive number and increase sequentially. This ID becomes especially handy if you're using Webhooks, since it allows you to ignore repeated updates or to restore the correct update sequence, should they get out of order. If there are no new updates for at least a week, then identifier of the next update will be chosen randomly instead of sequentially.

docFields.name: message
docFields.description: Optional. New incoming message of any kind — text, photo, sticker, etc.

docFields.name: edited_message
docFields.description: Optional. New version of a message that is known to the bot and was edited

docFields.name: channel_post
docFields.description: Optional. New incoming channel post of any kind — text, photo, sticker, etc.

docFields.name: edited_channel_post
docFields.description: Optional. New version of a channel post that is known to the bot and was edited

docFields.name: inline_query
docFields.description: Optional. New incoming inline query

docFields.name: chosen_inline_result
docFields.description: Optional. The result of an inline query that was chosen by a user and sent to their chat partner. Please see our documentation on the feedback collecting for details on how to enable these updates for your bot.

docFields.name: callback_query
docFields.description: Optional. New incoming callback query

docFields.name: shipping_query
docFields.description: Optional. New incoming shipping query. Only for invoices with flexible price

docFields.name: pre_checkout_query
docFields.description: Optional. New incoming pre-checkout query. Contains full information about checkout

docFields.name: poll
docFields.description: Optional. New poll state. Bots receive only updates about stopped polls and polls, which are sent by the bot

docFields.name: poll_answer
docFields.description: Optional. A user changed their answer in a non-anonymous poll. Bots receive new votes only in polls that were sent by the bot itself.

docFields.name: my_chat_member
docFields.description: Optional. The bot's chat member status was updated in a chat. For private chats, this update is received only when the bot is blocked or unblocked by the user.

docFields.name: chat_member
docFields.description: Optional. A chat member's status was updated in a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify “chat_member” in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates.

docTypes.name: WebhookInfo
docTypes.description: Contains information about the current status of a webhook.

docFields.name: url
docFields.description: Webhook URL, may be empty if webhook is not set up

docFields.name: has_custom_certificate
docFields.description: True, if a custom certificate was provided for webhook certificate checks

docFields.name: pending_update_count
docFields.description: Number of updates awaiting delivery

docFields.name: ip_address
docFields.description: Optional. Currently used webhook IP address

docFields.name: last_error_date
docFields.description: Optional. Unix time for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

docFields.name: last_error_message
docFields.description: Optional. Error message in human-readable format for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

docFields.name: max_connections
docFields.description: Optional. Maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery

docFields.name: allowed_updates
docFields.description: Optional. A list of update types the bot is subscribed to. Defaults to all update types except chat_member

docMethods.name: getUpdates
docMethods.description:
Use this method to receive incoming updates using long polling (wiki). An Array of Update objects is returned.

Notes
1. This method will not work if an outgoing webhook is set up.
2. In order to avoid getting duplicate updates, recalculate offset after each server response.

docParameters.name: offset
docParameters.description: Identifier of the first update to be returned. Must be greater by one than the highest among the identifiers of previously received updates. By default, updates starting with the earliest unconfirmed update are returned. An update is considered confirmed as soon as getUpdates is called with an offset higher than its update_id. The negative offset can be specified to retrieve updates starting from -offset update from the end of the updates queue. All previous updates will forgotten.

docParameters.name: limit
docParameters.description: Limits the number of updates to be retrieved. Values between 1-100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

docParameters.name: timeout
docParameters.description: Timeout in seconds for long polling. Defaults to 0, i.e. usual short polling. Should be positive, short polling should be used for testing purposes only.

docParameters.name: allowed_updates
docParameters.description:
A JSON-serialized list of the update types you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all update types except chat_member (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.

Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the getUpdates, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

docMethods.name: setWebhook
docMethods.description:
Use this method to specify a url and receive incoming updates via an outgoing webhook. Whenever there is an update for the bot, we will send an HTTPS POST request to the specified url, containing a JSON-serialized Update. In case of an unsuccessful request, we will give up after a reasonable amount of attempts. Returns True on success.

If you'd like to make sure that the Webhook request comes from Telegram, we recommend using a secret path in the URL, e.g. https://www.example.com/<token>. Since nobody else knows your bot's token, you can be pretty sure it's us.

Notes
1. You will not be able to receive updates using getUpdates for as long as an outgoing webhook is set up.
2. To use a self-signed certificate, you need to upload your public key certificate using certificate parameter. Please upload as InputFile, sending a String will not work.
3. Ports currently supported for Webhooks: 443, 80, 88, 8443.

NEW! If you're having any trouble setting up webhooks, please check out this amazing guide to Webhooks.

docParameters.name: url
docParameters.description: HTTPS url to send updates to. Use an empty string to remove webhook integration

docParameters.name: certificate
docParameters.description: Upload your public key certificate so that the root certificate in use can be checked. See our self-signed guide for details.

docParameters.name: ip_address
docParameters.description: The fixed IP address which will be used to send webhook requests instead of the IP address resolved through DNS

docParameters.name: max_connections
docParameters.description: Maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery, 1-100. Defaults to 40. Use lower values to limit the load on your bot's server, and higher values to increase your bot's throughput.

docParameters.name: allowed_updates
docParameters.description:
A JSON-serialized list of the update types you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all update types except chat_member (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.
Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the setWebhook, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

docParameters.name: drop_pending_updates
docParameters.description: Pass True to drop all pending updates

docMethods.name: deleteWebhook
docMethods.description: Use this method to remove webhook integration if you decide to switch back to getUpdates. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: drop_pending_updates
docParameters.description: Pass True to drop all pending updates

docMethods.name: getWebhookInfo
docMethods.description: Use this method to get current webhook status. Requires no parameters. On success, returns a WebhookInfo object. If the bot is using getUpdates, will return an object with the url field empty.

name: Available types
description:
All types used in the Bot API responses are represented as JSON-objects.

It is safe to use 32-bit signed integers for storing all Integer fields unless otherwise noted.

Optional fields may be not returned when irrelevant.

docTypes.name: User
docTypes.description: This object represents a Telegram user or bot.

docFields.name: id
docFields.description: Unique identifier for this user or bot. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

docFields.name: is_bot
docFields.description: True, if this user is a bot

docFields.name: first_name
docFields.description: User's or bot's first name

docFields.name: last_name
docFields.description: Optional. User's or bot's last name

docFields.name: username
docFields.description: Optional. User's or bot's username

docFields.name: language_code
docFields.description: Optional. IETF language tag of the user's language

docFields.name: can_join_groups
docFields.description: Optional. True, if the bot can be invited to groups. Returned only in getMe.

docFields.name: can_read_all_group_messages
docFields.description: Optional. True, if privacy mode is disabled for the bot. Returned only in getMe.

docFields.name: supports_inline_queries
docFields.description: Optional. True, if the bot supports inline queries. Returned only in getMe.

docTypes.name: Chat
docTypes.description: This object represents a chat.

docFields.name: id
docFields.description: Unique identifier for this chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

docFields.name: type
docFields.description: Type of chat, can be either “private”, “group”, “supergroup” or “channel”

docFields.name: title
docFields.description: Optional. Title, for supergroups, channels and group chats

docFields.name: username
docFields.description: Optional. Username, for private chats, supergroups and channels if available

docFields.name: first_name
docFields.description: Optional. First name of the other party in a private chat

docFields.name: last_name
docFields.description: Optional. Last name of the other party in a private chat

docFields.name: photo
docFields.description: Optional. Chat photo. Returned only in getChat.

docFields.name: bio
docFields.description: Optional. Bio of the other party in a private chat. Returned only in getChat.

docFields.name: description
docFields.description: Optional. Description, for groups, supergroups and channel chats. Returned only in getChat.

docFields.name: invite_link
docFields.description: Optional. Primary invite link, for groups, supergroups and channel chats. Returned only in getChat.

docFields.name: pinned_message
docFields.description: Optional. The most recent pinned message (by sending date). Returned only in getChat.

docFields.name: permissions
docFields.description: Optional. Default chat member permissions, for groups and supergroups. Returned only in getChat.

docFields.name: slow_mode_delay
docFields.description: Optional. For supergroups, the minimum allowed delay between consecutive messages sent by each unpriviledged user. Returned only in getChat.

docFields.name: message_auto_delete_time
docFields.description: Optional. The time after which all messages sent to the chat will be automatically deleted; in seconds. Returned only in getChat.

docFields.name: sticker_set_name
docFields.description: Optional. For supergroups, name of group sticker set. Returned only in getChat.

docFields.name: can_set_sticker_set
docFields.description: Optional. True, if the bot can change the group sticker set. Returned only in getChat.

docFields.name: linked_chat_id
docFields.description: Optional. Unique identifier for the linked chat, i.e. the discussion group identifier for a channel and vice versa; for supergroups and channel chats. This identifier may be greater than 32 bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it is smaller than 52 bits, so a signed 64 bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. Returned only in getChat.

docFields.name: location
docFields.description: Optional. For supergroups, the location to which the supergroup is connected. Returned only in getChat.

docTypes.name: Message
docTypes.description: This object represents a message.

docFields.name: message_id
docFields.description: Unique message identifier inside this chat

docFields.name: from
docFields.description: Optional. Sender, empty for messages sent to channels

docFields.name: sender_chat
docFields.description: Optional. Sender of the message, sent on behalf of a chat. The channel itself for channel messages. The supergroup itself for messages from anonymous group administrators. The linked channel for messages automatically forwarded to the discussion group

docFields.name: date
docFields.description: Date the message was sent in Unix time

docFields.name: chat
docFields.description: Conversation the message belongs to

docFields.name: forward_from
docFields.description: Optional. For forwarded messages, sender of the original message

docFields.name: forward_from_chat
docFields.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels or from anonymous administrators, information about the original sender chat

docFields.name: forward_from_message_id
docFields.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels, identifier of the original message in the channel

docFields.name: forward_signature
docFields.description: Optional. For messages forwarded from channels, signature of the post author if present

docFields.name: forward_sender_name
docFields.description: Optional. Sender's name for messages forwarded from users who disallow adding a link to their account in forwarded messages

docFields.name: forward_date
docFields.description: Optional. For forwarded messages, date the original message was sent in Unix time

docFields.name: reply_to_message
docFields.description: Optional. For replies, the original message. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it itself is a reply.

docFields.name: via_bot
docFields.description: Optional. Bot through which the message was sent

docFields.name: edit_date
docFields.description: Optional. Date the message was last edited in Unix time

docFields.name: media_group_id
docFields.description: Optional. The unique identifier of a media message group this message belongs to

docFields.name: author_signature
docFields.description: Optional. Signature of the post author for messages in channels, or the custom title of an anonymous group administrator

docFields.name: text
docFields.description: Optional. For text messages, the actual UTF-8 text of the message, 0-4096 characters

docFields.name: entities
docFields.description: Optional. For text messages, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the text

docFields.name: animation
docFields.description: Optional. Message is an animation, information about the animation. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the document field will also be set

docFields.name: audio
docFields.description: Optional. Message is an audio file, information about the file

docFields.name: document
docFields.description: Optional. Message is a general file, information about the file

docFields.name: photo
docFields.description: Optional. Message is a photo, available sizes of the photo

docFields.name: sticker
docFields.description: Optional. Message is a sticker, information about the sticker

docFields.name: video
docFields.description: Optional. Message is a video, information about the video

docFields.name: video_note
docFields.description: Optional. Message is a video note, information about the video message

docFields.name: voice
docFields.description: Optional. Message is a voice message, information about the file

docFields.name: caption
docFields.description: Optional. Caption for the animation, audio, document, photo, video or voice, 0-1024 characters

docFields.name: caption_entities
docFields.description: Optional. For messages with a caption, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the caption

docFields.name: contact
docFields.description: Optional. Message is a shared contact, information about the contact

docFields.name: dice
docFields.description: Optional. Message is a dice with random value

docFields.name: game
docFields.description: Optional. Message is a game, information about the game. More about games »

docFields.name: poll
docFields.description: Optional. Message is a native poll, information about the poll

docFields.name: venue
docFields.description: Optional. Message is a venue, information about the venue. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the location field will also be set

docFields.name: location
docFields.description: Optional. Message is a shared location, information about the location

docFields.name: new_chat_members
docFields.description: Optional. New members that were added to the group or supergroup and information about them (the bot itself may be one of these members)

docFields.name: left_chat_member
docFields.description: Optional. A member was removed from the group, information about them (this member may be the bot itself)

docFields.name: new_chat_title
docFields.description: Optional. A chat title was changed to this value

docFields.name: new_chat_photo
docFields.description: Optional. A chat photo was change to this value

docFields.name: delete_chat_photo
docFields.description: Optional. Service message: the chat photo was deleted

docFields.name: group_chat_created
docFields.description: Optional. Service message: the group has been created

docFields.name: supergroup_chat_created
docFields.description: Optional. Service message: the supergroup has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a supergroup when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a directly created supergroup.

docFields.name: channel_chat_created
docFields.description: Optional. Service message: the channel has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a channel when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a channel.

docFields.name: message_auto_delete_timer_changed
docFields.description: Optional. Service message: auto-delete timer settings changed in the chat

docFields.name: migrate_to_chat_id
docFields.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

docFields.name: migrate_from_chat_id
docFields.description: Optional. The supergroup has been migrated from a group with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

docFields.name: pinned_message
docFields.description: Optional. Specified message was pinned. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it is itself a reply.

docFields.name: invoice
docFields.description: Optional. Message is an invoice for a payment, information about the invoice. More about payments »

docFields.name: successful_payment
docFields.description: Optional. Message is a service message about a successful payment, information about the payment. More about payments »

docFields.name: connected_website
docFields.description: Optional. The domain name of the website on which the user has logged in. More about Telegram Login »

docFields.name: passport_data
docFields.description: Optional. Telegram Passport data

docFields.name: proximity_alert_triggered
docFields.description: Optional. Service message. A user in the chat triggered another user's proximity alert while sharing Live Location.

docFields.name: voice_chat_started
docFields.description: Optional. Service message: voice chat started

docFields.name: voice_chat_ended
docFields.description: Optional. Service message: voice chat ended

docFields.name: voice_chat_participants_invited
docFields.description: Optional. Service message: new participants invited to a voice chat

docFields.name: reply_markup
docFields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message. login_url buttons are represented as ordinary url buttons.

docTypes.name: MessageId
docTypes.description: This object represents a unique message identifier.

docFields.name: message_id
docFields.description: Unique message identifier

docTypes.name: MessageEntity
docTypes.description: This object represents one special entity in a text message. For example, hashtags, usernames, URLs, etc.

docFields.name: type
docFields.description: Type of the entity. Can be “mention” (@username), “hashtag” (#hashtag), “cashtag” ($USD), “bot_command” (/start@jobs_bot), “url” (https://telegram.org), “email” (do-not-reply@telegram.org), “phone_number” (+1-212-555-0123), “bold” (bold text), “italic” (italic text), “underline” (underlined text), “strikethrough” (strikethrough text), “code” (monowidth string), “pre” (monowidth block), “text_link” (for clickable text URLs), “text_mention” (for users without usernames)

docFields.name: offset
docFields.description: Offset in UTF-16 code units to the start of the entity

docFields.name: length
docFields.description: Length of the entity in UTF-16 code units

docFields.name: url
docFields.description: Optional. For “text_link” only, url that will be opened after user taps on the text

docFields.name: user
docFields.description: Optional. For “text_mention” only, the mentioned user

docFields.name: language
docFields.description: Optional. For “pre” only, the programming language of the entity text

docTypes.name: PhotoSize
docTypes.description: This object represents one size of a photo or a file / sticker thumbnail.

docFields.name: file_id
docFields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

docFields.name: file_unique_id
docFields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

docFields.name: width
docFields.description: Photo width

docFields.name: height
docFields.description: Photo height

docFields.name: file_size
docFields.description: Optional. File size

docTypes.name: Animation
docTypes.description: This object represents an animation file (GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound).

docFields.name: file_id
docFields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

docFields.name: file_unique_id
docFields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

docFields.name: width
docFields.description: Video width as defined by sender

docFields.name: height
docFields.description: Video height as defined by sender

docFields.name: duration
docFields.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by sender

docFields.name: thumb
docFields.description: Optional. Animation thumbnail as defined by sender

docFields.name: file_name
docFields.description: Optional. Original animation filename as defined by sender

docFields.name: mime_type
docFields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

docFields.name: file_size
docFields.description: Optional. File size

docFields.name: file_id
docFields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

docFields.name: file_unique_id
docFields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

docFields.name: duration
docFields.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by sender

docFields.name: performer
docFields.description: Optional. Performer of the audio as defined by sender or by audio tags

docFields.name: title
docFields.description: Optional. Title of the audio as defined by sender or by audio tags

docFields.name: file_name
docFields.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by sender

docFields.name: mime_type
docFields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

docFields.name: file_size
docFields.description: Optional. File size

docFields.name: thumb
docFields.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the album cover to which the music file belongs

docFields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

docFields.name: thumb

docFields.name: file_name
docFields.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by sender

docFields.name: mime_type
docFields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by sender

docFields.name: file_size

docFields.description: List of poll options

docFields.name: total_voter_count
docFields.description: Total number of users that voted in the poll

docFields.name: is_closed
docFields.description: True, if the poll is closed

docFields.name: is_anonymous
docFields.description: True, if the poll is anonymous

docFields.name: type
docFields.description: Poll type, currently can be “regular” or “quiz”

docFields.name: allows_multiple_answers
docFields.description: True, if the poll allows multiple answers

docFields.name: correct_option_id
docFields.description: Optional. 0-based identifier of the correct answer option. Available only for polls in the quiz mode, which are closed, or was sent (not forwarded) by the bot or to the private chat with the bot.

docFields.name: explanation
docFields.description: Optional. Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters

docFields.name: explanation_entities
docFields.description: Optional. Special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the explanation

docFields.name: open_period
docFields.description: Optional. Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation

docFields.name: close_date
docFields.description: Optional. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed

docTypes.name: Location
docTypes.description: This object represents a point on the map.

docFields.name: longitude
docFields.description: Longitude as defined by sender

docFields.name: latitude
docFields.description: Latitude as defined by sender

docFields.name: horizontal_accuracy
docFields.description: Optional. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

docFields.name: live_period
docFields.description: Optional. Time relative to the message sending date, during which the location can be updated, in seconds. For active live locations only.

docFields.name: heading
docFields.description: Optional. The direction in which user is moving, in degrees; 1-360. For active live locations only.

docFields.name: proximity_alert_radius
docFields.description: Optional. Maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. For sent live locations only.

docTypes.name: Venue
docTypes.description: This object represents a venue.

docFields.name: location
docFields.description: Venue location. Can't be a live location

docFields.name: title
docFields.description: Name of the venue

docFields.name: address
docFields.description: Address of the venue

docFields.name: foursquare_id
docFields.description: Optional. Foursquare identifier of the venue

docFields.name: foursquare_type
docFields.description: Optional. Foursquare type of the venue. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

docFields.name: google_place_id
docFields.description: Optional. Google Places identifier of the venue

docFields.name: google_place_type
docFields.description: Optional. Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)

docTypes.name: ProximityAlertTriggered
docTypes.description: This object represents the content of a service message, sent whenever a user in the chat triggers a proximity alert set by another user.

docFields.name: traveler
docFields.description: User that triggered the alert

docFields.name: watcher
docFields.description: User that set the alert

docFields.name: distance
docFields.description: The distance between the users

docTypes.name: MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged
docTypes.description: This object represents a service message about a change in auto-delete timer settings.

docFields.name: message_auto_delete_time
docFields.description: New auto-delete time for messages in the chat

docTypes.name: VoiceChatEnded
docTypes.description: This object represents a service message about a voice chat ended in the chat.

docFields.name: duration
docFields.description: Voice chat duration; in seconds

docTypes.name: VoiceChatParticipantsInvited
docTypes.description: This object represents a service message about new members invited to a voice chat.

docFields.name: users
docFields.description: Optional. New members that were invited to the voice chat

docTypes.name: UserProfilePhotos
docTypes.description: This object represent a user's profile pictures.

docFields.name: total_count
docFields.description: Total number of profile pictures the target user has

docFields.name: photos
docFields.description: Requested profile pictures (in up to 4 sizes each)

docTypes.name: File
docTypes.description:
This object represents a file ready to be downloaded. The file can be downloaded via the link https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling getFile.

Maximum file size to download is 20 MB

docFields.name: file_id
docFields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

docFields.name: file_unique_id
docFields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

docFields.name: file_size
docFields.description: Optional. File size, if known

docFields.name: file_path
docFields.description: Optional. File path. Use https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path> to get the file.

docTypes.name: ReplyKeyboardMarkup
docTypes.description: This object represents a custom keyboard with reply options (see Introduction to bots for details and examples).

docFields.name: keyboard
docFields.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of KeyboardButton objects

docFields.name: resize_keyboard
docFields.description: Optional. Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.

docFields.name: one_time_keyboard
docFields.description: Optional. Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat – the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again. Defaults to false.

docFields.name: selective
docFields.description:
Optional. Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

Example: A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.

docTypes.name: KeyboardButton
docTypes.description:
This object represents one button of the reply keyboard. For simple text buttons String can be used instead of this object to specify text of the button. Optional fields request_contact, request_location, and request_poll are mutually exclusive.

Note: request_contact and request_location options will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will display unsupported message.
Note: request_poll option will only work in Telegram versions released after 23 January, 2020. Older clients will display unsupported message.

docFields.name: text
docFields.description: Text of the button. If none of the optional fields are used, it will be sent as a message when the button is pressed

docFields.name: request_contact
docFields.description: Optional. If True, the user's phone number will be sent as a contact when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only

docFields.name: request_location
docFields.description: Optional. If True, the user's current location will be sent when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only

docFields.name: request_poll
docFields.description: Optional. If specified, the user will be asked to create a poll and send it to the bot when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only

docTypes.name: KeyboardButtonPollType
docTypes.description: This object represents type of a poll, which is allowed to be created and sent when the corresponding button is pressed.

docFields.name: type
docFields.description: Optional. If quiz is passed, the user will be allowed to create only polls in the quiz mode. If regular is passed, only regular polls will be allowed. Otherwise, the user will be allowed to create a poll of any type.

docTypes.name: ReplyKeyboardRemove
docTypes.description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will remove the current custom keyboard and display the default letter-keyboard. By default, custom keyboards are displayed until a new keyboard is sent by a bot. An exception is made for one-time keyboards that are hidden immediately after the user presses a button (see ReplyKeyboardMarkup).

docFields.name: remove_keyboard
docFields.description: Requests clients to remove the custom keyboard (user will not be able to summon this keyboard; if you want to hide the keyboard from sight but keep it accessible, use one_time_keyboard in ReplyKeyboardMarkup)

docFields.name: selective
docFields.description:
Optional. Use this parameter if you want to remove the keyboard for specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

Example: A user votes in a poll, bot returns confirmation message in reply to the vote and removes the keyboard for that user, while still showing the keyboard with poll options to users who haven't voted yet.

docTypes.name: InlineKeyboardMarkup
docTypes.description:
This object represents an inline keyboard that appears right next to the message it belongs to.

Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will display unsupported message.

docFields.name: inline_keyboard
docFields.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of InlineKeyboardButton objects

docTypes.name: InlineKeyboardButton
docTypes.description: This object represents one button of an inline keyboard. You must use exactly one of the optional fields.

docFields.name: text
docFields.description: Label text on the button

docFields.name: url
docFields.description: Optional. HTTP or tg:// url to be opened when button is pressed

docFields.name: login_url
docFields.description: Optional. An HTTP URL used to automatically authorize the user. Can be used as a replacement for the Telegram Login Widget.

docFields.name: callback_data
docFields.description: Optional. Data to be sent in a callback query to the bot when button is pressed, 1-64 bytes

docFields.name: switch_inline_query
docFields.description:
Optional. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field. Can be empty, in which case just the bot's username will be inserted.

Note: This offers an easy way for users to start using your bot in inline mode when they are currently in a private chat with it. Especially useful when combined with switch_pm… actions – in this case the user will be automatically returned to the chat they switched from, skipping the chat selection screen.

docFields.name: switch_inline_query_current_chat
docFields.description:
Optional. If set, pressing the button will insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the current chat's input field. Can be empty, in which case only the bot's username will be inserted.

This offers a quick way for the user to open your bot in inline mode in the same chat – good for selecting something from multiple options.

docFields.name: callback_game
docFields.description:
Optional. Description of the game that will be launched when the user presses the button.

NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row.

docFields.name: pay
docFields.description:
Optional. Specify True, to send a Pay button.

NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row.

docTypes.name: LoginUrl
docTypes.description:
This object represents a parameter of the inline keyboard button used to automatically authorize a user. Serves as a great replacement for the Telegram Login Widget when the user is coming from Telegram. All the user needs to do is tap/click a button and confirm that they want to log in:

Telegram apps support these buttons as of version 5.7.

Sample bot: @discussbot

docFields.name: url
docFields.description:
An HTTP URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in Receiving authorization data.

NOTE: You must always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in Checking authorization.

docFields.name: forward_text
docFields.description: Optional. New text of the button in forwarded messages.

docFields.name: bot_username
docFields.description: Optional. Username of a bot, which will be used for user authorization. See Setting up a bot for more details. If not specified, the current bot's username will be assumed. The url's domain must be the same as the domain linked with the bot. See Linking your domain to the bot for more details.

docFields.name: request_write_access
docFields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the permission for your bot to send messages to the user.

docTypes.name: CallbackQuery
docTypes.description:
This object represents an incoming callback query from a callback button in an inline keyboard. If the button that originated the query was attached to a message sent by the bot, the field message will be present. If the button was attached to a message sent via the bot (in inline mode), the field inline_message_id will be present. Exactly one of the fields data or game_short_name will be present.

NOTE: After the user presses a callback button, Telegram clients will display a progress bar until you call answerCallbackQuery. It is, therefore, necessary to react by calling answerCallbackQuery even if no notification to the user is needed (e.g., without specifying any of the optional parameters).

docFields.name: id
docFields.description: Unique identifier for this query

docFields.name: from
docFields.description: Sender

docFields.name: message
docFields.description: Optional. Message with the callback button that originated the query. Note that message content and message date will not be available if the message is too old

docFields.name: inline_message_id
docFields.description: Optional. Identifier of the message sent via the bot in inline mode, that originated the query.

docFields.name: chat_instance
docFields.description: Global identifier, uniquely corresponding to the chat to which the message with the callback button was sent. Useful for high scores in games.

docFields.name: data
docFields.description: Optional. Data associated with the callback button. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

docFields.name: game_short_name
docFields.description: Optional. Short name of a Game to be returned, serves as the unique identifier for the game

docTypes.name: ForceReply
docTypes.description:
Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will display a reply interface to the user (act as if the user has selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'). This can be extremely useful if you want to create user-friendly step-by-step interfaces without having to sacrifice privacy mode.

Example: A poll bot for groups runs in privacy mode (only receives commands, replies to its messages and mentions). There could be two ways to create a new poll:

  • Explain the user how to send a command with parameters (e.g. /newpoll question answer1 answer2). May be appealing for hardcore users but lacks modern day polish.
  • Guide the user through a step-by-step process. 'Please send me your question', 'Cool, now let's add the first answer option', 'Great. Keep adding answer options, then send /done when you're ready'.

The last option is definitely more attractive. And if you use ForceReply in your bot's questions, it will receive the user's answers even if it only receives replies, commands and mentions — without any extra work for the user.

docFields.name: force_reply
docFields.description: Shows reply interface to the user, as if they manually selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'

docFields.name: selective
docFields.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to force reply from specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

docTypes.name: ChatPhoto
docTypes.description: This object represents a chat photo.

docFields.name: small_file_id
docFields.description: File identifier of small (160x160) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

docFields.name: small_file_unique_id
docFields.description: Unique file identifier of small (160x160) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

docFields.name: big_file_id
docFields.description: File identifier of big (640x640) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

docFields.name: big_file_unique_id
docFields.description: Unique file identifier of big (640x640) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

docTypes.name: ChatInviteLink
docTypes.description: Represents an invite link for a chat.

docFields.name: invite_link
docFields.description: The invite link. If the link was created by another chat administrator, then the second part of the link will be replaced with “…”.

docFields.name: creator
docFields.description: Creator of the link

docFields.name: is_primary
docFields.description: True, if the link is primary

docFields.name: is_revoked
docFields.description: True, if the link is revoked

docFields.name: expire_date
docFields.description: Optional. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire or has been expired

docFields.name: member_limit
docFields.description: Optional. Maximum number of users that can be members of the chat simultaneously after joining the chat via this invite link; 1-99999

docTypes.name: ChatMember
docTypes.description: This object contains information about one member of a chat.

docFields.name: user
docFields.description: Information about the user

docFields.name: status
docFields.description: The member's status in the chat. Can be “creator”, “administrator”, “member”, “restricted”, “left” or “kicked”

docFields.name: custom_title
docFields.description: Optional. Owner and administrators only. Custom title for this user

docFields.name: is_anonymous
docFields.description: Optional. Owner and administrators only. True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

docFields.name: can_be_edited
docFields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the bot is allowed to edit administrator privileges of that user

docFields.name: can_manage_chat
docFields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the administrator can access the chat event log, chat statistics, message statistics in channels, see channel members, see anonymous administrators in supergroups and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege

docFields.name: can_post_messages
docFields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the administrator can post in the channel; channels only

docFields.name: can_edit_messages
docFields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; channels only

docFields.name: can_delete_messages
docFields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

docFields.name: can_manage_voice_chats
docFields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the administrator can manage voice chats

docFields.name: can_restrict_members
docFields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members

docFields.name: can_promote_members
docFields.description: Optional. Administrators only. True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that he has promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

docFields.name: can_change_info
docFields.description: Optional. Administrators and restricted only. True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

docFields.name: can_invite_users
docFields.description: Optional. Administrators and restricted only. True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

docFields.name: can_pin_messages
docFields.description: Optional. Administrators and restricted only. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages; groups and supergroups only

docFields.name: is_member
docFields.description: Optional. Restricted only. True, if the user is a member of the chat at the moment of the request

docFields.name: can_send_messages
docFields.description: Optional. Restricted only. True, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, locations and venues

docFields.name: can_send_media_messages
docFields.description: Optional. Restricted only. True, if the user is allowed to send audios, documents, photos, videos, video notes and voice notes

docFields.name: can_send_polls
docFields.description: Optional. Restricted only. True, if the user is allowed to send polls

docFields.name: can_send_other_messages
docFields.description: Optional. Restricted only. True, if the user is allowed to send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots

docFields.name: can_add_web_page_previews
docFields.description: Optional. Restricted only. True, if the user is allowed to add web page previews to their messages

docFields.name: until_date
docFields.description: Optional. Restricted and kicked only. Date when restrictions will be lifted for this user; unix time

docTypes.name: ChatMemberUpdated
docTypes.description: This object represents changes in the status of a chat member.

docFields.name: chat
docFields.description: Chat the user belongs to

docFields.name: from
docFields.description: Performer of the action, which resulted in the change

docFields.name: date
docFields.description: Date the change was done in Unix time

docFields.name: old_chat_member
docFields.description: Previous information about the chat member

docFields.name: new_chat_member
docFields.description: New information about the chat member

docFields.name: invite_link
docFields.description: Optional. Chat invite link, which was used by the user to join the chat; for joining by invite link events only.

docTypes.name: ChatPermissions
docTypes.description: Describes actions that a non-administrator user is allowed to take in a chat.

docFields.name: can_send_messages
docFields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, locations and venues

docFields.name: can_send_media_messages
docFields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send audios, documents, photos, videos, video notes and voice notes, implies can_send_messages

docFields.name: can_send_polls
docFields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send polls, implies can_send_messages

docFields.name: can_send_other_messages
docFields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots, implies can_send_media_messages

docFields.name: can_add_web_page_previews
docFields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to add web page previews to their messages, implies can_send_media_messages

docFields.name: can_change_info
docFields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings. Ignored in public supergroups

docFields.name: can_invite_users
docFields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

docFields.name: can_pin_messages
docFields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages. Ignored in public supergroups

docTypes.name: ChatLocation
docTypes.description: Represents a location to which a chat is connected.

docFields.name: location
docFields.description: The location to which the supergroup is connected. Can't be a live location.

docFields.name: address
docFields.description: Location address; 1-64 characters, as defined by the chat owner

docTypes.name: BotCommand
docTypes.description: This object represents a bot command.

docFields.name: command
docFields.description: Text of the command, 1-32 characters. Can contain only lowercase English letters, digits and underscores.

docFields.name: description
docFields.description: Description of the command, 3-256 characters.

docTypes.name: ResponseParameters
docTypes.description: Contains information about why a request was unsuccessful.

docFields.name: migrate_to_chat_id
docFields.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

docFields.name: retry_after
docFields.description: Optional. In case of exceeding flood control, the number of seconds left to wait before the request can be repeated

docTypes.name: InputMediaPhoto
docTypes.description: Represents a photo to be sent.

docFields.name: type
docFields.description: Type of the result, must be photo

docFields.name: media
docFields.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More info on Sending Files »

docFields.name: caption
docFields.description: Optional. Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

docFields.name: parse_mode
docFields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See formatting options for more details.

docFields.name: caption_entities
docFields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

docTypes.name: InputMediaVideo
docTypes.description: Represents a video to be sent.

docFields.name: type
docFields.description: Type of the result, must be video

docFields.name: media
docFields.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More info on Sending Files »

docFields.name: thumb
docFields.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More info on Sending Files »

docFields.name: caption
docFields.description: Optional. Caption of the video to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

docFields.name: parse_mode

docFields.name: caption_entities

docFields.name: height

docFields.name: duration

docFields.name: supports_streaming

docFields.name: width

docFields.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. docFields.name: caption
docFields.description: Optional. Caption of the audio to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

docFields.name: parse_mode

name: Available methods
description:
All methods in the Bot API are case-insensitive. We support GET and POST HTTP methods. Use either URL query string or application/json or application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data for passing parameters in Bot API requests.
On successful call, a JSON-object containing the result will be returned.

docMethods.name: logOut
docMethods.description: Use this method to log out from the cloud Bot API server before launching the bot locally. You must log out the bot before running it locally, otherwise there is no guarantee that the bot will receive updates. After a successful call, you can immediately log in on a local server, but will not be able to log in back to the cloud Bot API server for 10 minutes. Returns True on success. Requires no parameters.

docMethods.name: close
docMethods.description: Use this method to close the bot instance before moving it from one local server to another. You need to delete the webhook before calling this method to ensure that the bot isn't launched again after server restart. The method will return error 429 in the first 10 minutes after the bot is launched. Returns True on success. Requires no parameters.

docMethods.name: sendMessage
docMethods.description: Use this method to send text messages. On success, the sent Message is returned.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: text
docParameters.description: Text of the message to be sent, 1-4096 characters after entities parsing

docParameters.name: parse_mode
docParameters.description: Mode for parsing entities in the message text. See formatting options for more details.

docParameters.name: entities
docParameters.description: List of special entities that appear in message text, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

docParameters.name: disable_web_page_preview
docParameters.description: Disables link previews for links in this message

docParameters.name: disable_notification
docParameters.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

docParameters.name: reply_to_message_id
docParameters.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

docParameters.name: allow_sending_without_reply
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

docParameters.name: reply_markup
docParameters.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

For sending voice messages, use the sendVoice method instead.
