docParameters.description: True, if the poll needs to be anonymous, defaults to True

docParameters.name: type
docParameters.description: Poll type, “quiz” or “regular”, defaults to “regular”

docParameters.name: allows_multiple_answers
docParameters.description: True, if the poll allows multiple answers, ignored for polls in quiz mode, defaults to False

docParameters.name: correct_option_id
docParameters.description: 0-based identifier of the correct answer option, required for polls in quiz mode

docParameters.name: explanation
docParameters.description: Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters with at most 2 line feeds after entities parsing

docParameters.name: explanation_parse_mode
docParameters.description: Mode for parsing entities in the explanation. See formatting options for more details.

docParameters.name: explanation_entities
docParameters.description: List of special entities that appear in the poll explanation, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

docParameters.name: open_period
docParameters.description: Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation, 5-600. Can't be used together with close_date.

docParameters.name: close_date
docParameters.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed. Must be at least 5 and no more than 600 seconds in the future. Can't be used together with open_period.

docParameters.name: is_closed
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the poll needs to be immediately closed. This can be useful for poll preview.

docParameters.name: disable_notification
docParameters.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

docParameters.name: reply_to_message_id
docParameters.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

docParameters.name: allow_sending_without_reply
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

docParameters.name: reply_markup
docParameters.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

docMethods.name: sendDice
docMethods.description: Use this method to send an animated emoji that will display a random value. On success, the sent Message is returned.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: emoji
docParameters.description: Emoji on which the dice throw animation is based. Currently, must be one of “”, “”, “”, “”, “”, or “”. Dice can have values 1-6 for “”, “” and “”, values 1-5 for “” and “”, and values 1-64 for “”. Defaults to “”

docParameters.name: disable_notification
docParameters.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

docParameters.name: reply_to_message_id
docParameters.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

docParameters.name: allow_sending_without_reply
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

docParameters.name: reply_markup
docParameters.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

docMethods.name: sendChatAction
docMethods.description:
Use this method when you need to tell the user that something is happening on the bot's side. The status is set for 5 seconds or less (when a message arrives from your bot, Telegram clients clear its typing status). Returns True on success.

Example: The ImageBot needs some time to process a request and upload the image. Instead of sending a text message along the lines of “Retrieving image, please wait…”, the bot may use sendChatAction with action = upload_photo. The user will see a “sending photo” status for the bot.

We only recommend using this method when a response from the bot will take a noticeable amount of time to arrive.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: action
docParameters.description: Type of action to broadcast. Choose one, depending on what the user is about to receive: typing for text messages, upload_photo for photos, record_video or upload_video for videos, record_voice or upload_voice for voice notes, upload_document for general files, find_location for location data, record_video_note or upload_video_note for video notes.

docMethods.name: getUserProfilePhotos
docMethods.description: Use this method to get a list of profile pictures for a user. Returns a UserProfilePhotos object.

docParameters.name: user_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier of the target user

docParameters.name: offset
docParameters.description: Sequential number of the first photo to be returned. By default, all photos are returned.

docParameters.name: limit
docParameters.description: Limits the number of photos to be retrieved. Values between 1-100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

docMethods.name: getFile
docMethods.description:
Use this method to get basic info about a file and prepare it for downloading. For the moment, bots can download files of up to 20MB in size. On success, a File object is returned. The file can then be downloaded via the link https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>, where <file_path> is taken from the response. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling getFile again.

Note: This function may not preserve the original file name and MIME type. You should save the file's MIME type and name (if available) when the File object is received.

docParameters.name: file_id
docParameters.description: File identifier to get info about

docMethods.name: kickChatMember
docMethods.description: Use this method to kick a user from a group, a supergroup or a channel. In the case of supergroups and channels, the user will not be able to return to the chat on their own using invite links, etc., unless unbanned first. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target group or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: user_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier of the target user

docParameters.name: until_date
docParameters.description: Date when the user will be unbanned, unix time. If user is banned for more than 366 days or less than 30 seconds from the current time they are considered to be banned forever. Applied for supergroups and channels only.

docParameters.name: revoke_messages
docParameters.description: Pass True to delete all messages from the chat for the user that is being removed. If False, the user will be able to see messages in the group that were sent before the user was removed. Always True for supergroups and channels.

docMethods.name: unbanChatMember
docMethods.description: Use this method to unban a previously kicked user in a supergroup or channel. The user will not return to the group or channel automatically, but will be able to join via link, etc. The bot must be an administrator for this to work. By default, this method guarantees that after the call the user is not a member of the chat, but will be able to join it. So if the user is a member of the chat they will also be removed from the chat. If you don't want this, use the parameter only_if_banned. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target group or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @username)

docParameters.name: user_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier of the target user

docParameters.name: only_if_banned
docParameters.description: Do nothing if the user is not banned

docMethods.name: restrictChatMember
docMethods.description: Use this method to restrict a user in a supergroup. The bot must be an administrator in the supergroup for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Pass True for all permissions to lift restrictions from a user. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

docParameters.name: user_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier of the target user

docParameters.name: permissions
docParameters.description: A JSON-serialized object for new user permissions

docParameters.name: until_date
docParameters.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for the user, unix time. If user is restricted for more than 366 days or less than 30 seconds from the current time, they are considered to be restricted forever

docMethods.name: promoteChatMember
docMethods.description: Use this method to promote or demote a user in a supergroup or a channel. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Pass False for all boolean parameters to demote a user. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: user_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier of the target user

docParameters.name: is_anonymous
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the administrator's presence in the chat is hidden

docParameters.name: can_manage_chat
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the administrator can access the chat event log, chat statistics, message statistics in channels, see channel members, see anonymous administrators in supergroups and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege

docParameters.name: can_post_messages
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the administrator can create channel posts, channels only

docParameters.name: can_edit_messages
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages, channels only

docParameters.name: can_delete_messages
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

docParameters.name: can_manage_voice_chats
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the administrator can manage voice chats

docParameters.name: can_restrict_members
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members

docParameters.name: can_promote_members
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that he has promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by him)

docParameters.name: can_change_info
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the administrator can change chat title, photo and other settings

docParameters.name: can_invite_users
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the administrator can invite new users to the chat

docParameters.name: can_pin_messages
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the administrator can pin messages, supergroups only

docMethods.name: setChatAdministratorCustomTitle
docMethods.description: Use this method to set a custom title for an administrator in a supergroup promoted by the bot. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

docParameters.name: user_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier of the target user

docParameters.name: custom_title
docParameters.description: New custom title for the administrator; 0-16 characters, emoji are not allowed

docMethods.name: setChatPermissions
docMethods.description: Use this method to set default chat permissions for all members. The bot must be an administrator in the group or a supergroup for this to work and must have the can_restrict_members admin rights. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

docParameters.name: permissions
docParameters.description: New default chat permissions

docMethods.name: exportChatInviteLink
docMethods.description:
Use this method to generate a new primary invite link for a chat; any previously generated primary link is revoked. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns the new invite link as String on success.

Note: Each administrator in a chat generates their own invite links. Bots can't use invite links generated by other administrators. If you want your bot to work with invite links, it will need to generate its own link using exportChatInviteLink or by calling the getChat method. If your bot needs to generate a new primary invite link replacing its previous one, use exportChatInviteLink again.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docMethods.name: createChatInviteLink
docMethods.description: Use this method to create an additional invite link for a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. The link can be revoked using the method revokeChatInviteLink. Returns the new invite link as ChatInviteLink object.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: expire_date
docParameters.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire

docParameters.name: member_limit
docParameters.description: Maximum number of users that can be members of the chat simultaneously after joining the chat via this invite link; 1-99999

docMethods.name: editChatInviteLink
docMethods.description: Use this method to edit a non-primary invite link created by the bot. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns the edited invite link as a ChatInviteLink object.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: invite_link
docParameters.description: The invite link to edit

docParameters.name: expire_date
docParameters.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire

docParameters.name: member_limit
docParameters.description: Maximum number of users that can be members of the chat simultaneously after joining the chat via this invite link; 1-99999

docMethods.name: revokeChatInviteLink
docMethods.description: Use this method to revoke an invite link created by the bot. If the primary link is revoked, a new link is automatically generated. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns the revoked invite link as ChatInviteLink object.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier of the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: invite_link
docParameters.description: The invite link to revoke

docMethods.name: setChatPhoto
docMethods.description: Use this method to set a new profile photo for the chat. Photos can't be changed for private chats. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: photo
docParameters.description: New chat photo, uploaded using multipart/form-data

docMethods.name: deleteChatPhoto
docMethods.description: Use this method to delete a chat photo. Photos can't be changed for private chats. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docMethods.name: setChatTitle
docMethods.description: Use this method to change the title of a chat. Titles can't be changed for private chats. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: title
docParameters.description: New chat title, 1-255 characters

docMethods.name: setChatDescription
docMethods.description: Use this method to change the description of a group, a supergroup or a channel. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: description
docParameters.description: New chat description, 0-255 characters

docMethods.name: pinChatMessage
docMethods.description: Use this method to add a message to the list of pinned messages in a chat. If the chat is not a private chat, the bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the 'can_pin_messages' admin right in a supergroup or 'can_edit_messages' admin right in a channel. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: message_id
docParameters.description: Identifier of a message to pin

docParameters.name: disable_notification
docParameters.description: Pass True, if it is not necessary to send a notification to all chat members about the new pinned message. Notifications are always disabled in channels and private chats.

docMethods.name: unpinChatMessage
docMethods.description: Use this method to remove a message from the list of pinned messages in a chat. If the chat is not a private chat, the bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the 'can_pin_messages' admin right in a supergroup or 'can_edit_messages' admin right in a channel. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: message_id
docParameters.description: Identifier of a message to unpin. If not specified, the most recent pinned message (by sending date) will be unpinned.

docMethods.name: unpinAllChatMessages
docMethods.description: Use this method to clear the list of pinned messages in a chat. If the chat is not a private chat, the bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the 'can_pin_messages' admin right in a supergroup or 'can_edit_messages' admin right in a channel. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docMethods.name: leaveChat
docMethods.description: Use this method for your bot to leave a group, supergroup or channel. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

docMethods.name: getChat
docMethods.description: Use this method to get up to date information about the chat (current name of the user for one-on-one conversations, current username of a user, group or channel, etc.). Returns a Chat object on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

docMethods.name: getChatAdministrators
docMethods.description: Use this method to get a list of administrators in a chat. On success, returns an Array of ChatMember objects that contains information about all chat administrators except other bots. If the chat is a group or a supergroup and no administrators were appointed, only the creator will be returned.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

docMethods.name: getChatMembersCount
docMethods.description: Use this method to get the number of members in a chat. Returns Int on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

docMethods.name: getChatMember
docMethods.description: Use this method to get information about a member of a chat. Returns a ChatMember object on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: user_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier of the target user

docMethods.name: setChatStickerSet
docMethods.description: Use this method to set a new group sticker set for a supergroup. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Use the field can_set_sticker_set optionally returned in getChat requests to check if the bot can use this method. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

docParameters.name: sticker_set_name
docParameters.description: Name of the sticker set to be set as the group sticker set

docMethods.name: deleteChatStickerSet
docMethods.description: Use this method to delete a group sticker set from a supergroup. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights. Use the field can_set_sticker_set optionally returned in getChat requests to check if the bot can use this method. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)

docMethods.name: answerCallbackQuery
docMethods.description:
Use this method to send answers to callback queries sent from inline keyboards. The answer will be displayed to the user as a notification at the top of the chat screen or as an alert. On success, True is returned.

Alternatively, the user can be redirected to the specified Game URL. For this option to work, you must first create a game for your bot via @Botfather and accept the terms. Otherwise, you may use links like t.me/your_bot?start=XXXX that open your bot with a parameter.

docParameters.name: callback_query_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

docParameters.name: text
docParameters.description: Text of the notification. If not specified, nothing will be shown to the user, 0-200 characters

docParameters.name: show_alert
docParameters.description: If true, an alert will be shown by the client instead of a notification at the top of the chat screen. Defaults to false.

docParameters.name: url
docParameters.description:
URL that will be opened by the user's client. If you have created a Game and accepted the conditions via @Botfather, specify the URL that opens your game — note that this will only work if the query comes from a callback_game button.

Otherwise, you may use links like t.me/your_bot?start=XXXX that open your bot with a parameter.

docParameters.name: cache_time
docParameters.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the result of the callback query may be cached client-side. Telegram apps will support caching starting in version 3.14. Defaults to 0.

docMethods.name: setMyCommands
docMethods.description: Use this method to change the list of the bot's commands. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: commands
docParameters.description: A JSON-serialized list of bot commands to be set as the list of the bot's commands. At most 100 commands can be specified.

docMethods.name: getMyCommands
docMethods.description: Use this method to get the current list of the bot's commands. Requires no parameters. Returns Array of BotCommand on success.

name: Updating messages
description:
The following methods allow you to change an existing message in the message history instead of sending a new one with a result of an action. This is most useful for messages with inline keyboards using callback queries, but can also help reduce clutter in conversations with regular chat bots.

Please note, that it is currently only possible to edit messages without reply_markup or with inline keyboards.

docMethods.name: editMessageText
docMethods.description: Use this method to edit text and game messages. On success, if the edited message is not an inline message, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: message_id
docParameters.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

docParameters.name: inline_message_id
docParameters.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

docParameters.name: text
docParameters.description: New text of the message, 1-4096 characters after entities parsing

docParameters.name: parse_mode
docParameters.description: Mode for parsing entities in the message text. See formatting options for more details.

docParameters.name: entities
docParameters.description: List of special entities that appear in message text, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

docParameters.name: disable_web_page_preview
docParameters.description: Disables link previews for links in this message

docParameters.name: reply_markup
docParameters.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard.

docMethods.name: editMessageCaption
docMethods.description: Use this method to edit captions of messages. On success, if the edited message is not an inline message, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: message_id
docParameters.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

docParameters.name: inline_message_id
docParameters.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

docParameters.name: caption
docParameters.description: New caption of the message, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

docParameters.name: parse_mode
docParameters.description: Mode for parsing entities in the message caption. See formatting options for more details.

docParameters.name: caption_entities
docParameters.description: List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

docParameters.name: reply_markup
docParameters.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard.

docMethods.name: editMessageMedia
docMethods.description: Use this method to edit animation, audio, document, photo, or video messages. If a message is part of a message album, then it can be edited only to an audio for audio albums, only to a document for document albums and to a photo or a video otherwise. When an inline message is edited, a new file can't be uploaded. Use a previously uploaded file via its file_id or specify a URL. On success, if the edited message was sent by the bot, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: message_id
docParameters.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

docParameters.name: inline_message_id
docParameters.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

docParameters.name: media
docParameters.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new media content of the message

docParameters.name: reply_markup
docParameters.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new inline keyboard.

docMethods.name: editMessageReplyMarkup
docMethods.description: Use this method to edit only the reply markup of messages. On success, if the edited message is not an inline message, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: message_id
docParameters.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message to edit

docParameters.name: inline_message_id
docParameters.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

docParameters.name: reply_markup
docParameters.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard.

docMethods.name: stopPoll
docMethods.description: Use this method to stop a poll which was sent by the bot. On success, the stopped Poll with the final results is returned.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: message_id
docParameters.description: Identifier of the original message with the poll

docParameters.name: reply_markup
docParameters.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new message inline keyboard.

docMethods.name: deleteMessage
docMethods.description:
Use this method to delete a message, including service messages, with the following limitations:
- A message can only be deleted if it was sent less than 48 hours ago.
- A dice message in a private chat can only be deleted if it was sent more than 24 hours ago.
- Bots can delete outgoing messages in private chats, groups, and supergroups.
- Bots can delete incoming messages in private chats.
- Bots granted can_post_messages permissions can delete outgoing messages in channels.
- If the bot is an administrator of a group, it can delete any message there.
- If the bot has can_delete_messages permission in a supergroup or a channel, it can delete any message there.
Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: message_id
docParameters.description: Identifier of the message to delete

name: Stickers
description: The following methods and objects allow your bot to handle stickers and sticker sets.

docTypes.name: Sticker
docTypes.description: This object represents a sticker.

docFields.name: file_id
docFields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

docFields.name: file_unique_id
docFields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

docFields.name: width
docFields.description: Sticker width

docFields.name: height
docFields.description: Sticker height

docFields.name: is_animated
docFields.description: True, if the sticker is animated

docFields.name: thumb
docFields.description: Optional. Sticker thumbnail in the .WEBP or .JPG format

docFields.name: emoji
docFields.description: Optional. Emoji associated with the sticker

docFields.name: set_name
docFields.description: Optional. Name of the sticker set to which the sticker belongs

docFields.name: mask_position
docFields.description: Optional. For mask stickers, the position where the mask should be placed

docFields.name: file_size
docFields.description: Optional. File size

docTypes.name: StickerSet
docTypes.description: This object represents a sticker set.

docFields.name: name
docFields.description: Sticker set name

docFields.name: title
docFields.description: Sticker set title

docFields.name: is_animated
docFields.description: True, if the sticker set contains animated stickers

docFields.name: contains_masks
docFields.description: True, if the sticker set contains masks

docFields.name: stickers
docFields.description: List of all set stickers

docFields.name: thumb
docFields.description: Optional. Sticker set thumbnail in the .WEBP or .TGS format

docTypes.name: MaskPosition
docTypes.description: This object describes the position on faces where a mask should be placed by default.

docFields.name: point
docFields.description: The part of the face relative to which the mask should be placed. One of “forehead”, “eyes”, “mouth”, or “chin”.

docFields.name: x_shift
docFields.description: Shift by X-axis measured in widths of the mask scaled to the face size, from left to right. For example, choosing -1.0 will place mask just to the left of the default mask position.

docFields.name: y_shift
docFields.description: Shift by Y-axis measured in heights of the mask scaled to the face size, from top to bottom. For example, 1.0 will place the mask just below the default mask position.

docFields.name: scale
docFields.description: Mask scaling coefficient. For example, 2.0 means double size.

docMethods.name: sendSticker
docMethods.description: Use this method to send static .WEBP or animated .TGS stickers. On success, the sent Message is returned.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)

docParameters.name: sticker
docParameters.description: Sticker to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a .WEBP file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More info on Sending Files »

docParameters.name: disable_notification
docParameters.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

docParameters.name: reply_to_message_id
docParameters.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

docParameters.name: allow_sending_without_reply
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

docParameters.name: reply_markup
docParameters.description: Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

docMethods.name: getStickerSet
docMethods.description: Use this method to get a sticker set. On success, a StickerSet object is returned.

docParameters.name: name
docParameters.description: Name of the sticker set

docMethods.name: uploadStickerFile
docMethods.description: Use this method to upload a .PNG file with a sticker for later use in createNewStickerSet and addStickerToSet methods (can be used multiple times). Returns the uploaded File on success.

docParameters.name: user_id
docParameters.description: User identifier of sticker file owner

docParameters.name: png_sticker
docParameters.description: PNG image with the sticker, must be up to 512 kilobytes in size, dimensions must not exceed 512px, and either width or height must be exactly 512px. More info on Sending Files »

docMethods.name: createNewStickerSet
docMethods.description: Use this method to create a new sticker set owned by a user. The bot will be able to edit the sticker set thus created. You must use exactly one of the fields png_sticker or tgs_sticker. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: user_id
docParameters.description: User identifier of created sticker set owner

docParameters.name: name
docParameters.description: Short name of sticker set, to be used in t.me/addstickers/ URLs (e.g., animals). Can contain only english letters, digits and underscores. Must begin with a letter, can't contain consecutive underscores and must end in “_by_<bot username>”. <bot_username> is case insensitive. 1-64 characters.

docParameters.name: title
docParameters.description: Sticker set title, 1-64 characters

docParameters.name: png_sticker
docParameters.description: PNG image with the sticker, must be up to 512 kilobytes in size, dimensions must not exceed 512px, and either width or height must be exactly 512px. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More info on Sending Files »

docParameters.name: tgs_sticker
docParameters.description: TGS animation with the sticker, uploaded using multipart/form-data. See https://core.telegram.org/animated_stickers#technical-requirements for technical requirements

docParameters.name: emojis
docParameters.description: One or more emoji corresponding to the sticker

docParameters.name: contains_masks
docParameters.description: Pass True, if a set of mask stickers should be created

docParameters.name: mask_position
docParameters.description: A JSON-serialized object for position where the mask should be placed on faces

docMethods.name: addStickerToSet
docMethods.description: Use this method to add a new sticker to a set created by the bot. You must use exactly one of the fields png_sticker or tgs_sticker. Animated stickers can be added to animated sticker sets and only to them. Animated sticker sets can have up to 50 stickers. Static sticker sets can have up to 120 stickers. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: user_id
docParameters.description: User identifier of sticker set owner

docParameters.name: name
docParameters.description: Sticker set name

docParameters.name: png_sticker
docParameters.description: PNG image with the sticker, must be up to 512 kilobytes in size, dimensions must not exceed 512px, and either width or height must be exactly 512px. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More info on Sending Files »

docParameters.name: tgs_sticker
docParameters.description: TGS animation with the sticker, uploaded using multipart/form-data. See https://core.telegram.org/animated_stickers#technical-requirements for technical requirements

docParameters.name: emojis
docParameters.description: One or more emoji corresponding to the sticker

docParameters.name: mask_position
docParameters.description: A JSON-serialized object for position where the mask should be placed on faces

docMethods.name: setStickerPositionInSet
docMethods.description: Use this method to move a sticker in a set created by the bot to a specific position. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: sticker
docParameters.description: File identifier of the sticker

docParameters.name: position
docParameters.description: New sticker position in the set, zero-based

docMethods.name: deleteStickerFromSet
docMethods.description: Use this method to delete a sticker from a set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: sticker
docParameters.description: File identifier of the sticker

docMethods.name: setStickerSetThumb
docMethods.description: Use this method to set the thumbnail of a sticker set. Animated thumbnails can be set for animated sticker sets only. Returns True on success.

docParameters.name: name
docParameters.description: Sticker set name

docParameters.name: user_id
docParameters.description: User identifier of the sticker set owner

docParameters.name: thumb
docParameters.description: A PNG image with the thumbnail, must be up to 128 kilobytes in size and have width and height exactly 100px, or a TGS animation with the thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size; see https://core.telegram.org/animated_stickers#technical-requirements for animated sticker technical requirements. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More info on Sending Files ». Animated sticker set thumbnail can't be uploaded via HTTP URL.

name: Inline mode
description:
The following methods and objects allow your bot to work in inline mode.
Please see our Introduction to Inline bots for more details.

To enable this option, send the /setinline command to @BotFather and provide the placeholder text that the user will see in the input field after typing your bot's name.

docTypes.name: InlineQuery
docTypes.description: This object represents an incoming inline query. When the user sends an empty query, your bot could return some default or trending results.

docFields.name: id
docFields.description: Unique identifier for this query

docFields.name: from
docFields.description: Sender

docFields.name: location
docFields.description: Optional. Sender location, only for bots that request user location

docFields.name: query
docFields.description: Text of the query (up to 256 characters)

docFields.name: offset
docFields.description: Offset of the results to be returned, can be controlled by the bot

docTypes.name: InlineQueryResultArticle
docTypes.description: Represents a link to an article or web page.

docFields.name: type
docFields.description: Type of the result, must be article

docFields.name: id
docFields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes

docFields.name: title
docFields.description: Title of the result

docFields.name: input_message_content
docFields.description: Content of the message to be sent

docFields.name: reply_markup
docFields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

docFields.name: url
docFields.description: Optional. URL of the result

docFields.name: hide_url
docFields.description: Optional. Pass True, if you don't want the URL to be shown in the message

docFields.name: description
docFields.description: Optional. Short description of the result

docFields.name: thumb_url
docFields.description: Optional. Url of the thumbnail for the result

docFields.name: thumb_width
docFields.description: Optional. Thumbnail width

docFields.name: thumb_height
docFields.description: Optional. Thumbnail height

docTypes.name: InlineQueryResultPhoto
docTypes.description: Represents a link to a photo. By default, this photo will be sent by the user with optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the photo.

docFields.name: type
docFields.description: Type of the result, must be photo

docFields.name: id
docFields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

docFields.name: photo_url
docFields.description: A valid URL of the photo. Photo must be in jpeg format. Photo size must not exceed 5MB

docFields.name: thumb_url
docFields.description: URL of the thumbnail for the photo

docFields.name: photo_width
docFields.description: Optional. Width of the photo

docFields.name: photo_height
docFields.description: Optional. Height of the photo

docFields.name: title
docFields.description: Optional. Title for the result

docFields.name: description
docFields.description: Optional. Short description of the result

docFields.name: caption
docFields.description: Optional. Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

docFields.name: parse_mode
docFields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See formatting options for more details.

docFields.name: caption_entities
docFields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

docFields.name: reply_markup
docFields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

docFields.name: input_message_content
docFields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the photo

docTypes.name: InlineQueryResultGif
docTypes.description: Represents a link to an animated GIF file. By default, this animated GIF file will be sent by the user with optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the animation.

docFields.name: type
docFields.description: Type of the result, must be gif

docFields.name: id

docFields.name: gif_width
docFields.description: Optional. Width of the GIF

docFields.name: gif_height
docFields.description: Optional. Height of the GIF

docFields.name: gif_duration

docFields.description: URL of the static (JPEG or GIF) or animated (MPEG4) thumbnail for the result

docFields.name: thumb_mime_type
docFields.description: Optional. MIME type of the thumbnail, must be one of “image/jpeg”, “image/gif”, or “video/mp4”. Defaults to “image/jpeg”

docFields.name: caption

docFields.name: parse_mode

docFields.name: caption_entities
docFields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

docFields.name: reply_markup
docFields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

docFields.name: input_message_content
docFields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the GIF animation

docTypes.name: InlineQueryResultVideo
docTypes.description:
Represents a link to a page containing an embedded video player or a video file. By default, this video file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the video.

If an InlineQueryResultVideo message contains an embedded video (e.g., YouTube), you must replace its content using input_message_content.

docFields.name: caption_entities
docFields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode

docFields.name: video_width
docFields.description: Optional. Video width

docFields.name: video_height
docFields.description: Optional. Video height

docFields.name: video_duration
docFields.description: Optional. Video duration in seconds

docFields.description: Optional. Short description of the result

docFields.name: reply_markup
docFields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message

docFields.name: input_message_content
docFields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the video. This field is required if InlineQueryResultVideo is used to send an HTML-page as a result (e.g., a YouTube video).

docFields.name: live_period
docFields.description: Optional. Period in seconds for which the location can be updated, should be between 60 and 86400.

docFields.name: heading
docFields.description: Optional. For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

docFields.name: proximity_alert_radius

docTypes.name: ChosenInlineResult
docTypes.description:
Represents a result of an inline query that was chosen by the user and sent to their chat partner.

Note: It is necessary to enable inline feedback via @Botfather in order to receive these objects in updates.

docFields.name: result_id
docFields.description: The unique identifier for the result that was chosen

docFields.name: from
docFields.description: The user that chose the result

docFields.name: location
docFields.description: Optional. Sender location, only for bots that require user location

docFields.name: inline_message_id
docFields.description: Optional. Identifier of the sent inline message. Available only if there is an inline keyboard attached to the message. Will be also received in callback queries and can be used to edit the message.

docFields.name: query
docFields.description: The query that was used to obtain the result

docMethods.name: answerInlineQuery
docMethods.description:
Use this method to send answers to an inline query. On success, True is returned.
No more than 50 results per query are allowed.

docParameters.name: inline_query_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the answered query

docParameters.name: results
docParameters.description: A JSON-serialized array of results for the inline query

docParameters.name: cache_time
docParameters.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the result of the inline query may be cached on the server. Defaults to 300.

docParameters.name: is_personal
docParameters.description: Pass True, if results may be cached on the server side only for the user that sent the query. By default, results may be returned to any user who sends the same query

docParameters.name: next_offset
docParameters.description: Pass the offset that a client should send in the next query with the same text to receive more results. Pass an empty string if there are no more results or if you don't support pagination. Offset length can't exceed 64 bytes.

docParameters.name: switch_pm_text
docParameters.description: If passed, clients will display a button with specified text that switches the user to a private chat with the bot and sends the bot a start message with the parameter switch_pm_parameter

docParameters.name: switch_pm_parameter
docParameters.description:
Deep-linking parameter for the /start message sent to the bot when user presses the switch button. 1-64 characters, only A-Z, a-z, 0-9, _ and - are allowed.

Example: An inline bot that sends YouTube videos can ask the user to connect the bot to their YouTube account to adapt search results accordingly. To do this, it displays a 'Connect your YouTube account' button above the results, or even before showing any. The user presses the button, switches to a private chat with the bot and, in doing so, passes a start parameter that instructs the bot to return an oauth link. Once done, the bot can offer a switch_inline button so that the user can easily return to the chat where they wanted to use the bot's inline capabilities.

name: Payments
description: Your bot can accept payments from Telegram users. Please see the introduction to payments for more details on the process and how to set up payments for your bot. Please note that users will need Telegram v.4.0 or higher to use payments (released on May 18, 2017).

docTypes.name: LabeledPrice
docTypes.description: This object represents a portion of the price for goods or services.

docFields.name: label
docFields.description: Portion label

docFields.name: amount
docFields.description: Price of the product in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

docTypes.name: Invoice
docTypes.description: This object contains basic information about an invoice.

docFields.name: title

docFields.name: description

docFields.name: start_parameter

docFields.name: currency
docFields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code

docFields.name: total_amount
docFields.description: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

docMethods.name: sendInvoice
docMethods.description: Use this method to send invoices. On success, the sent Message is returned.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target private chat

docParameters.name: title
docParameters.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

docParameters.name: description
docParameters.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

docParameters.name: payload
docParameters.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use for your internal processes.

docParameters.name: provider_token
docParameters.description: Payments provider token, obtained via Botfather

docParameters.name: start_parameter
docParameters.description: Unique deep-linking parameter that can be used to generate this invoice when used as a start parameter

docParameters.name: currency
docParameters.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see more on currencies

docParameters.name: prices
docParameters.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.)

docParameters.name: provider_data
docParameters.description: A JSON-serialized data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

docParameters.name: photo_url
docParameters.description: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service. People like it better when they see what they are paying for.

docParameters.name: photo_size
docParameters.description: Photo size

docParameters.name: photo_width
docParameters.description: Photo width

docParameters.name: photo_height
docParameters.description: Photo height

docParameters.name: need_name
docParameters.description: Pass True, if you require the user's full name to complete the order

docParameters.name: need_phone_number
docParameters.description: Pass True, if you require the user's phone number to complete the order

docParameters.name: need_email
docParameters.description: Pass True, if you require the user's email address to complete the order

docParameters.name: need_shipping_address
docParameters.description: Pass True, if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order

docParameters.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
docParameters.description: Pass True, if user's phone number should be sent to provider

docParameters.name: send_email_to_provider
docParameters.description: Pass True, if user's email address should be sent to provider

docParameters.name: is_flexible
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the final price depends on the shipping method

docParameters.name: disable_notification
docParameters.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

docParameters.name: reply_to_message_id
docParameters.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

docParameters.name: allow_sending_without_reply
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

docParameters.name: reply_markup
docParameters.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard. If empty, one 'Pay total price' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must be a Pay button.

docMethods.name: answerShippingQuery
docMethods.description: If you sent an invoice requesting a shipping address and the parameter is_flexible was specified, the Bot API will send an Update with a shipping_query field to the bot. Use this method to reply to shipping queries. On success, True is returned.

docParameters.name: shipping_query_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

docParameters.name: ok
docParameters.description: Specify True if delivery to the specified address is possible and False if there are any problems (for example, if delivery to the specified address is not possible)

docParameters.name: shipping_options
docParameters.description: Required if ok is True. A JSON-serialized array of available shipping options.

docParameters.name: error_message
docParameters.description: Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains why it is impossible to complete the order (e.g. "Sorry, delivery to your desired address is unavailable'). Telegram will display this message to the user.

docMethods.name: answerPreCheckoutQuery
docMethods.description: Once the user has confirmed their payment and shipping details, the Bot API sends the final confirmation in the form of an Update with the field pre_checkout_query. Use this method to respond to such pre-checkout queries. On success, True is returned. Note: The Bot API must receive an answer within 10 seconds after the pre-checkout query was sent.

docParameters.name: pre_checkout_query_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

docParameters.name: ok
docParameters.description: Specify True if everything is alright (goods are available, etc.) and the bot is ready to proceed with the order. Use False if there are any problems.

docParameters.name: error_message
docParameters.description: Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains the reason for failure to proceed with the checkout (e.g. "Sorry, somebody just bought the last of our amazing black T-shirts while you were busy filling out your payment details. Please choose a different color or garment!"). Telegram will display this message to the user.

name: Telegram Passport
description: Telegram Passport is a unified authorization method for services that require personal identification. Users can upload their documents once, then instantly share their data with services that require real-world ID (finance, ICOs, etc.). Please see the manual for details.

docTypes.name: PassportData
docTypes.description: Contains information about Telegram Passport data shared with the bot by the user.

docFields.name: data
docFields.description: Array with information about documents and other Telegram Passport elements that was shared with the bot

docFields.name: credentials
docFields.description: Encrypted credentials required to decrypt the data

docTypes.name: PassportFile
docTypes.description: This object represents a file uploaded to Telegram Passport. Currently all Telegram Passport files are in JPEG format when decrypted and don't exceed 10MB.

docFields.name: file_id
docFields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

docFields.name: file_unique_id
docFields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

docFields.name: file_size
docFields.description: File size

docFields.name: file_date
docFields.description: Unix time when the file was uploaded

docTypes.name: EncryptedPassportElement
docTypes.description: Contains information about documents or other Telegram Passport elements shared with the bot by the user.

docFields.name: type
docFields.description: Element type. One of “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “address”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”, “phone_number”, “email”.

docFields.name: data
docFields.description: Optional. Base64-encoded encrypted Telegram Passport element data provided by the user, available for “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport” and “address” types. Can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

docFields.name: phone_number
docFields.description: Optional. User's verified phone number, available only for “phone_number” type

docFields.name: email
docFields.description: Optional. User's verified email address, available only for “email” type

docFields.name: files
docFields.description: Optional. Array of encrypted files with documents provided by the user, available for “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration” and “temporary_registration” types. Files can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

docFields.name: front_side
docFields.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the front side of the document, provided by the user. Available for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card” and “internal_passport”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

docFields.name: reverse_side
docFields.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the reverse side of the document, provided by the user. Available for “driver_license” and “identity_card”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

docFields.name: selfie
docFields.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the selfie of the user holding a document, provided by the user; available for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card” and “internal_passport”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

docFields.name: translation
docFields.description: Optional. Array of encrypted files with translated versions of documents provided by the user. Available if requested for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration” and “temporary_registration” types. Files can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

docFields.name: hash
docFields.description: Base64-encoded element hash for using in PassportElementErrorUnspecified

docTypes.name: EncryptedCredentials
docTypes.description: Contains data required for decrypting and authenticating EncryptedPassportElement. See the Telegram Passport Documentation for a complete description of the data decryption and authentication processes.

docFields.name: data
docFields.description: Base64-encoded encrypted JSON-serialized data with unique user's payload, data hashes and secrets required for EncryptedPassportElement decryption and authentication

docFields.name: hash
docFields.description: Base64-encoded data hash for data authentication

docFields.name: secret
docFields.description: Base64-encoded secret, encrypted with the bot's public RSA key, required for data decryption

docTypes.name: PassportElementErrorDataField
docTypes.description: Represents an issue in one of the data fields that was provided by the user. The error is considered resolved when the field's value changes.

docFields.name: source
docFields.description: Error source, must be data

docFields.name: type
docFields.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the error, one of “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “address”

docFields.name: field_name
docFields.description: Name of the data field which has the error

docFields.name: data_hash
docFields.description: Base64-encoded data hash

docFields.name: message
docFields.description: Error message

docTypes.name: PassportElementErrorFrontSide
docTypes.description: Represents an issue with the front side of a document. The error is considered resolved when the file with the front side of the document changes.

docFields.name: source
docFields.description: Error source, must be front_side

docFields.name: type
docFields.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”

docFields.name: file_hash
docFields.description: Base64-encoded hash of the file with the front side of the document

docFields.name: message
docFields.description: Error message

docTypes.name: PassportElementErrorReverseSide
docTypes.description: Represents an issue with the reverse side of a document. The error is considered resolved when the file with reverse side of the document changes.

docFields.name: source
docFields.description: Error source, must be reverse_side

docFields.name: type
docFields.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “driver_license”, “identity_card”

docFields.name: file_hash
docFields.description: Base64-encoded hash of the file with the reverse side of the document

docFields.name: message
docFields.description: Error message

docTypes.name: PassportElementErrorSelfie
docTypes.description: Represents an issue with the selfie with a document. The error is considered resolved when the file with the selfie changes.

docFields.name: source

docMethods.name: setPassportDataErrors
docMethods.description:
Informs a user that some of the Telegram Passport elements they provided contains errors. The user will not be able to re-submit their Passport to you until the errors are fixed (the contents of the field for which you returned the error must change). Returns True on success.

Use this if the data submitted by the user doesn't satisfy the standards your service requires for any reason. For example, if a birthday date seems invalid, a submitted document is blurry, a scan shows evidence of tampering, etc. Supply some details in the error message to make sure the user knows how to correct the issues.

docParameters.name: user_id
docParameters.description: User identifier

docParameters.name: errors
docParameters.description: A JSON-serialized array describing the errors

name: Games
description:
Your bot can offer users HTML5 games to play solo or to compete against each other in groups and one-on-one chats. Create games via @BotFather using the /newgame command. Please note that this kind of power requires responsibility: you will need to accept the terms for each game that your bots will be offering.

  • Games are a new type of content on Telegram, represented by the Game and InlineQueryResultGame objects.
  • Once you've created a game via BotFather, you can send games to chats as regular messages using the sendGame method, or use inline mode with InlineQueryResultGame.
  • If you send the game message without any buttons, it will automatically have a 'Play GameName' button. When this button is pressed, your bot gets a CallbackQuery with the game_short_name of the requested game. You provide the correct URL for this particular user and the app opens the game in the in-app browser.
  • You can manually add multiple buttons to your game message. Please note that the first button in the first row must always launch the game, using the field callback_game in InlineKeyboardButton. You can add extra buttons according to taste: e.g., for a description of the rules, or to open the game's official community.
  • To make your game more attractive, you can upload a GIF animation that demostrates the game to the users via BotFather (see Lumberjack for example).
  • A game message will also display high scores for the current chat. Use setGameScore to post high scores to the chat with the game, add the edit_message parameter to automatically update the message with the current scoreboard.
  • Use getGameHighScores to get data for in-game high score tables.
  • You can also add an extra sharing button for users to share their best score to different chats.
  • For examples of what can be done using this new stuff, check the @gamebot and @gamee bots.

docTypes.name: Game
docTypes.description: This object represents a game. Use BotFather to create and edit games, their short names will act as unique identifiers.

docFields.name: title
docFields.description: Title of the game

docFields.name: description
docFields.description: Description of the game

docFields.name: photo
docFields.description: Photo that will be displayed in the game message in chats.

docFields.name: text
docFields.description: Optional. Brief description of the game or high scores included in the game message. Can be automatically edited to include current high scores for the game when the bot calls setGameScore, or manually edited using editMessageText. 0-4096 characters.

docFields.name: text_entities
docFields.description: Optional. Special entities that appear in text, such as usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc.

docFields.name: animation
docFields.description: Optional. Animation that will be displayed in the game message in chats. Upload via BotFather

This object represents one row of the high scores table for a game.

And that's about all we've got for now.
If you've got any questions, please check out our Bot FAQ »

docMethods.name: sendGame
docMethods.description: Use this method to send a game. On success, the sent Message is returned.

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Unique identifier for the target chat

docParameters.name: game_short_name
docParameters.description: Short name of the game, serves as the unique identifier for the game. Set up your games via Botfather.

docParameters.name: disable_notification
docParameters.description: Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.

docParameters.name: reply_to_message_id
docParameters.description: If the message is a reply, ID of the original message

docParameters.name: allow_sending_without_reply
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found

docParameters.name: reply_markup
docParameters.description: A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard. If empty, one 'Play game_title' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must launch the game.

docMethods.name: setGameScore
docMethods.description: Use this method to set the score of the specified user in a game. On success, if the message was sent by the bot, returns the edited Message, otherwise returns True. Returns an error, if the new score is not greater than the user's current score in the chat and force is False.

docParameters.name: user_id
docParameters.description: User identifier

docParameters.name: score
docParameters.description: New score, must be non-negative

docParameters.name: force
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the high score is allowed to decrease. This can be useful when fixing mistakes or banning cheaters

docParameters.name: disable_edit_message
docParameters.description: Pass True, if the game message should not be automatically edited to include the current scoreboard

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat

docParameters.name: message_id
docParameters.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the sent message

docParameters.name: inline_message_id
docParameters.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

docMethods.name: getGameHighScores
docMethods.description:
Use this method to get data for high score tables. Will return the score of the specified user and several of their neighbors in a game. On success, returns an Array of GameHighScore objects.

This method will currently return scores for the target user, plus two of their closest neighbors on each side. Will also return the top three users if the user and his neighbors are not among them. Please note that this behavior is subject to change.

docParameters.name: user_id
docParameters.description: Target user id

docParameters.name: chat_id
docParameters.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat

docParameters.name: message_id
docParameters.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the sent message

docParameters.name: inline_message_id
docParameters.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message
